FuncDef:
The dhcp relay arp user-detect interval command configures the ARP probe time for the DHCP relay user table.
The undo dhcp relay arp user-detect interval command restores the default configuration.
By default, the ARP probe time of the DHCP relay user table is 20 minutes.
CLIs: undo dhcp relay arp user-detect interval [ interval ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ARP probe time of the DHCP relay user table.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 60, in minutes. The value 0 indicates ARP probing is disabled.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In IP address unnumbering scenarios, if ARP probing is configured, static ARP cannot be bound to the involved user. Otherwise, ARP probing fails.
